title: "bad escape" error
body:
I'm trying to run the Stata kernel using Anaconda 3, python 3.7 and jupyter notebook in Windows 10. I'm encountering the following errors in getting the kernel running. Any suggestions?
```
KeyError: '\\s'
```
and
```
 File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\sre_parse.py", line 1024, in parse_template
    raise s.error('bad escape %s' % this, len(this))
re.error: bad escape \s at position 0
```
Here is the entirety of the output:
```

(base) C:\Users\phill>jupyter console --kernel stata
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\sre_parse.py", line 1021, in parse_template
    this = chr(ESCAPES[this][1])
KeyError: '\\s'


During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main
    "__main__", mod_spec)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code
    exec(code, run_globals)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\stata_kernel\__main__.py", line 4, in <module>
    IPKernelApp.launch_instance(kernel_class=StataKernel)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\traitlets\config\application.py", line 657, in launch_instance
    app.initialize(argv)
  File "<decorator-gen-124>", line 2, in initialize
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\traitlets\config\application.py", line 87, in catch_config_error
    return method(app, *args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\ipykernel\kernelapp.py", line 478, in initialize
    self.init_kernel()
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\ipykernel\kernelapp.py", line 389, in init_kernel
    user_ns=self.user_ns,
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\traitlets\config\configurable.py", line 412, in instance
    inst = cls(*args, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\stata_kernel\kernel.py", line 73, in __init__
    self.completions = CompletionsManager(self, self.conf)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\stata_kernel\completions.py", line 69, in __init__
    self.suggestions = self.get_suggestions(kernel)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\stata_kernel\completions.py", line 266, in get_suggestions
    match = self.matchall(self.quickdo('_StataKernelCompletions', kernel))
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\stata_kernel\completions.py", line 297, in quickdo
    text_to_run, md5, text_to_exclude = cm.get_text(kernel.conf)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\stata_kernel\code_manager.py", line 261, in get_text
    for x in user_graph_keywords.split(',')]
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\stata_kernel\code_manager.py", line 261, in <listcomp>
    for x in user_graph_keywords.split(',')]
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\re.py", line 192, in sub
    return _compile(pattern, flags).sub(repl, string, count)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\re.py", line 309, in _subx
    template = _compile_repl(template, pattern)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\re.py", line 300, in _compile_repl
    return sre_parse.parse_template(repl, pattern)
  File "C:\Users\phill\Anaconda3\lib\sre_parse.py", line 1024, in parse_template
    raise s.error('bad escape %s' % this, len(this))
re.error: bad escape \s at position 0
```
